result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey Howard Bagneski

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 8:32am
 Defendant Jeffrey Howard Bagneski in court.  Attorney Peter Anderson in court for Jeffrey Howard Bagneski.  Attorney Jeffrey Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews the court record. 

Scheduling is discussed; Defense requests additional status be scheduled out 15 to 30 days to allow further review of discovery.

On Defendant's Motion for Bond Modification: 
--Defense stands on written motion
--ADA Shock opposes motion

The Court grants motion. Modifies condition to: No violent contact with Victim 2 and not to discuss the case with Victim 2.
[post hearing/off record: Court clarifies that 'no presence' condition is to be stricken]
recess: 8:39am 

NEXT: Status on 11/10/22 at 10:30am
The motion will be heard on 10/17 unless a request is made to be heard sooner
Defendant's
Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] case called at 9:36am 
Defendant Jeffrey Howard Bagneski in court with Attorney Peter Anderson. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Anderson indicates that he just received discovery so time is need to review that and further discuss the case.  
recess 9:39am 

NEXT:  (1) clerk- please remove PD Office from the mailing matrix,  (2) Status Conference on October 17th at 8:30am.
Third Party Letter re no contact

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Peter Anderson
Status conference on August 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ml] Case called at 1:40PM
Defendant Jeffrey Howard Bagneski in court with attorney Karl E Huebner. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Att Huebner advises that the Defendant has requested that Att Huebner be removed from the case and that the Public Defender appoint successor counsel. Att Huebner expands, stating that the Defendant does no longer want to be represented by himself.

The Defendant makes a statement to the Court regarding Att Huebner's appointment.

The Court finds that there is irreconcilable differences between the Defendant and Att Huebner, and discharges Att Huebner from this file. The Court orders the Public Defender's Office to appoint the Defendant successor counsel.

The Court requests that the Defendant try his best to work with the next appointed attorney.

recess 1:46PM

NEXT: Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 08/08 at 9:30AM with in person appearances

[ml] Case called at 3:29PM
Defendant Jeffrey Howard Bagneski in court with attorney Karl E Huebner. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This hearing is scheduled for a Motion Hearing. The alleged victim now appears.
Att Huebner advises that both the Victim and the Defendant request that the bond be modified.
The alleged victim makes a statement to the Court.
Counsel provide arguments regarding the No Contact Order.

The Court declines to Modify Bond for reasons stated on the record.

Att Huebner advises that an offer exists, but requests that the Status remains on the Court's calendar.

recess 3:39PM

NEXT: Status Conference for 06/09 remains on the Court's calendar
Motion hearing on May 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[ma--no record made] Attorney Karl Huebner and ADA Brookellen Teuber are present in courtroom. 
Atty Huebner indicates that victim is unable to attend todays 3:30pm hearing. 
Without objection, the Court adjourns to 5/17/22 at 3:00pm
Motion hearing on May 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference on April 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion Regarding No Contact with Victim 2

[ma] Case called at 9:49 AM 
Defendant Jeffrey Howard Bagneski in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Huebner requests an additional pretrial and status be scheduled; give basis
--no objection from ADA Beck

Atty Huebner orally motions for bond modification
--ADA Beck objects
--the Court questsions Atty Huebner

The Court denies motion, bond remains as fixed.
recess: 9:51am
NEXT: (1)Pretrial on 4/13/22 at 9:00am (2)Status on 6/9/22 at 1:30pm
Scheduling Order
Karl Huebner
Court's Response to Third Party Letter re: Bond
Letter from Third party re bond

Pre-trial conference on March 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on March 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ae] case called 01:39 PM Defendant Jeffrey Howard Bagneski appears via Zoom from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody. Public Defender Cassie Nelson appeared via Zoom (the PD will appoint counsel) Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Pleas of "Not Guilty" are entered; speedy trial is waived by the Defendant.


The Court requires a $10,000 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Victim 1 or Victim 2
--no presence at Victim 2's residence; defendant may return to the residence on one occasion occupied by a law enforcement officer only, if there is any dispute over property it will need to be handled in the civil courts. 
--no consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--not to possess any dangerous weapons

recess 1:54  pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/2/22 at 9:00 am  (2) Status Conference on 3/24/22 at 9:00 am
